page.title: 11Chickney, energy
page.content: Electricity is laid on to all the hamlets,farms & cottages. Power lines crossing the area, connect with Stocking Pelham Electricity Sub-Station. There is no mains gas. Lighting, cooking & heating are by electricity, oil, solid fuel or bottle gas. Mains water is supplied by the Lee Valley Water Company and their water towers stand at Cutler's Green, Sibleys, with adjacent reservoir, &, with reservoir, at Chickney. Chickney Hall has a private reservoir. There is no mains drainage. A sand pit is being worked between the Starr Brook and the old railway. A wind pump fell into disuse and was removed 3 years ago. Chickney lies on the N/S watershed of the East Anglian Heights, on a line with Quendon Spring. South of this rivers drain to the Lea Valley, northwards to the Wash.
